Updated mod for RimWorld v1.1.
Beta 1.| - Framework addition: now possible to adjust melee attack damage for Hediffs and Hediff_Implants; refer to GitHub documentation for more info.
Beta 2.| - Fixed unexpected, critical "failed to apply Harmony patches" bug due to RimWorld update v1.1.2598
Beta 3.| - Fixed a NullReferenceException related to social fights.

Updated to RimWorld v1.2.| - Notice to C# modders: a new C# class EBFEndpoints is available to read the max HP of body parts under the effects of EBF; more details at the GitHub repo
Standardize entire mod to use namespace "EBF" to reduce confusion.

- Fixed potential tool-related null-reference error with Save Our Ships 2 - Improved tool comparison logic to reduce occurence of null-reference errors with various other bionic mods (please see if those errors are fixed!)
- Attack Power Adjustors now skips some problematic hediffs when checking applicability; should result in even less NullReferenceException
- Recalibrated this mod to be compatible with RW v1.3 - Pre-RW v1.3 compatibility is not affected; this is making use of the multi-version feature of RW
- Fixed Harmony patching conflicts with Pawnmorpher (not backported)

Traded some features: - [+] This mod no longer gives exception when used with Humanoid Alien Races; but - [-] EBF hediffs that increases pawn core part HP now does NOT reduce % chance of pawn getting stunned after taking blunt damage +-------------

Improved the previous trade: - [+] This mod no longer gives exception when used with Humanoid Alien Races; and - [+] EBF hediffs that increases pawn core part HP now CAN reduce % chance of pawn getting stunned after taking blunt damage (cancels the negative effects of v4.0.5) - [*] Now must be loaded before Humanoid Alien Races; PLEASE USE THE AUTO-SORT TO REAPPLY LOAD ORDER! +-------------|Special thanks to GitHub user RocketDelivery for this fix!

Merry Christmas!| - Added compatibility with EdB Prepare Carefully: you can now see correct body part max HP calculated by EBF without errors - Added compatibility with CM Callouts: you can now see correct motes (based on body part max HP) when a body part is destroyed - Added compatibility with Moody: you can now see correct body part max HP calculated by EBF without errors

Not much going on.| - Fixed max HP modification display formatting - Fixed verb power modification showing as max HP modification - Improved accuracy of detecting EdB Prepare Carefully: hopefully there are less false positives that leads to patching errors

Housekeeping, and some deeper thoughts.| - Fixed error wth Pawnmorpher; fundamentally, both mods tried to modify the same thing at the same time - Notice: EBF has detected a rare 3-mod conflict: using EBF + Pawnmorpher + CompactHediff together is discouraged until we figure out what is going on, and meanwhile if you only use at most 2 of them from that combo, you won't see any problems - Notice: EBF has noticed more and more 3rd party mods creating custom HP-increasing bionics without using EBF, which may cause confusion, incompatibilities, and incorrectness; EBF is currently thinking of a solution to this

Hi all! Elite Bionics Framework v5.0.| It has been about 4 years since the initial conception of Elite Bionics, and Elite Bionics Framework has grown so much. Thank you all for the continued support!| For a long time, I noticed that there are several mods out there that provides HP-increasing effects by themselves. I generally leave them be, but some of them are causing incompatibilities with EBF and with each other, which is problematic.| This is why I have decided to evolve EBF a bit more by letting it be a unifying bridge between the various mods that provide body part HP modification. I call this Community Unification.| Note that this mod only allows them to work with each other together; the individual effects are not modified in any way. You will still be seeing effects and numbers of the individual mods themselves.| And of course, disclaimers: I am not affiliated with any of the mod authors out there. I do not claim ownership on any of the mods out there. All I do is simply to ensure that all mods can run smoothly alongside each other.| - The Community Unification: a decision has been made to unify the many mods out there that modify body part max HP but may potentially conflict with each other - To XML modders depending on EBF: no update is needed - The inner code of EBF has been changed somewhat; C# modders be aware (even though I believe there aren't too many breaking changes) - I am unaffiliated to any of the mods below - I claim no ownerships of any of the mods below| - The following mods are unified: - Quality Bionics - CONN - Cyber Fauna - Pawnmorpher - GeneticRim/Vanilla Genetics Expanded - Level This - If QualityBionics is installed: fixed the wrong implementation of QualityBionics causing HP modification to double-count for eg arms and legs - If Pawnmorpher is installed: we standardized the patches with Pawnmorpher, so that we also show additional UI text dedicated to Pawnmorpher - Also fixed error with Pawnmorpher regarding "error setting up text" when reading body part summary| - Added some tips to the in-game tips library - No update needed for Compact Hediffs, unless they would like to readjust their UI using the latest EBF functions and methods

- Fixed unreasonale version-check error messages for MechalitCore and CyberFauna users
- Fixed extreme lag in the Form Caravan screen introduced in v5.0.0
- Fixed TargetParameterCountException while trying to read Pawnmorpher HP (fix was shipped in v5.0.4 as a random test but I was not aware of its effectiveness before this moment)

- Fixed body part max HP wrongly persisting over different pawns (error introduced in v5.0.4; the lag fix from v5.0.4 is still here) - (Version unknown) Pawnmorpher no longer gives harmless "Pawnmorpher violates the EBF Protocol" error message; protocol-checking is disabled for Pawnmorpher for compatibility reasons
- The following mods are unified: - Half dragons (v1.3 ver; mod ID Monti.HalfDragons, Steam ID 2556121262)

No new features, only an amendment to the v5.0.7 news: I wrote something wrong, so I intend to withdraw it and write it again. - Added compatibility with Half Dragons (v1.3 ver; mod ID Monti.HalfDragons, Steam ID 2556121262) - Half Dragons is NOT unified in any way! (tbh their mod does not boost body part HP, so there is nothing to unify)

Partially updated to RW v1.4; please see explanation below:| Seeing how a lot of extra features got added to this mod during RW v1.3, I will do the RW v1.4 update by stages:| - Stage 0: wait for Ludeon to release RW v1.4 (done) - Stage 1: wait for UnlimitedHugs to release HugsLib for v1.4 (done) > Stage 2: release EBF for v1.4 (<--- we are here) - Stage 3: wait for others to release their mod updates for v1.4 - Stage 4: reconfirm compatibility with related 3rd party mods| This will take a while. If you don't use too many related 3rd party mods, then perhaps this update is already sufficient; but if you are relying on the Community Unification features, I would suggest putting this on hold for a while until I complete rechecking everything.| Or, alternatively, you could go ahead and see if this update works with the related 3rd-party mods, saving me some time for rechecking.| This is something I came up with for RW 1.4/BioTech, which touches bionics. Perhaps this is the procedures going forward if any more (relevant) RimWorld update is released in the future.
Removed $HugsLibChecker from this mod because it is obsolete and is causing problems.

Updated compatibility with Cybernetic Organism and Neural Network (CONN).| A number of other mods were reviewed, and they were either not yet updated to match RW v1.4, or they worked fine with this version of EBF.

Fixed unexpected inompatibiity with Yayo's Animations (failed to patch [...]: invalid IL code) by moving one of EBF's patches even earlier in the execution order. Please use auto-sort to put this mod above Yayo's Animations!

A few things:| - Confirmed compatibility with Prepare Carefully [1.4] - Confirmed compatibility with Pawnmorpher [1.4] - Fixed "nullable object must have a value" error when e.g. the game checks for social fights for pawns having EBF-provided verb power adjustment (special credits to Evono for finding this out during an unrelated auto-test!) - Compatibility with Callouts [1.4] delayed due to unexpected owner change on Callouts's side - Compatibility with Save Our Ships 2 [1.4] pending
- Experimental: mods with no loaded contents (hopefully this means unloaded mods) are no longer detected by this mod for Community Unification; should reduce confusing error messages

I have noticed that CONN has officially chosen the Elite Bionics Framework to provide HP-buffing effects. Welcome CONN! And thank you for choosing the EBF.| - Removed CONN from the Community Unification scheme (note: CONN is now a regular EBF mod instead) - Using CONN will no longer throw red errors on game startup
- Removed CONN-related code from the DLL; maybe this fixes the performance drop?
- Optimized performance drop when looking at the Health tab on pawns (side effect: max HP display text may update slightly later after installing/changing EBF bionics)

A big update to Elite Bionics Framework in recent months.| - Added Multiplayer compatibility - Greatly optimized performance by using a better caching system; no more lag spikes! (in fact, no more lag in general...) - Thus, removed the "delayed update" side effects introduced in v5.0.8.8 - Optimized detection of Pawnmorpher in calculating body part max HP - Fixed wrong detection of active mods in determining cross-mod unification (completes the feature in v5.0.8.5) - Confirmed compatibility with Callouts 1.4 (by Profligate) - Re-added missing loading screen tips (whoops...)| Note: Multiplayer compatibility was tested on a local-self-to-self setup. Hopefully, it indicates general Multiplayer compatibility.
- Improved compatibility with RimThreaded

- "Compatibility with RimThreaded" no longer impacts performance too much (problem introduced in v5.1.1) - Optimized performance (should see less slowdowns when pawns are healing)| Note: you will probably see some lag shortly after starting/loading a game, but the lag will reduce over time, and that is normal; when a game is started/loaded, EBF is probably busy calculating the max HP values for all the newly-loaded pawns.
